The number of mapped reads examined which did not have a mapped mate pair, either because the read is unpaired, or the read is paired to an unmapped mate.
The number of mapped read pairs examined. (Primary, non-supplemental)
The total number of unmapped reads examined. (Primary, non-supplemental)
The number of fragments that were marked as duplicates.
The number of read pairs that were marked as duplicates.
The number of read pairs duplicates that were caused by optical duplication. Value is always < READ_PAIR_DUPLICATES, which counts all duplicates regardless of source.
The fraction of mapped sequence that is marked as duplicate.
The estimated number of unique molecules in the library based on PE duplication.
The MEDIAN insert size of all paired end reads where both ends mapped to the same chromosome.
The median absolute deviation of the distribution. If the distribution is essentially normal then the standard deviation can be estimated as ~1.4826 * MAD

The mean insert size of the "core" of the distribution. Artefactual outliers in the distribution often cause calculation of nonsensical mean and stdev values. To avoid this the distribution is first trimmed to a "core" distribution of +/- N median absolute deviations around the median insert size. By default N=10, but this is configurable.
Standard deviation of insert sizes over the "core" of the distribution.

The number of PF reads that are marked as noise reads. A noise read is one which is composed entirely of A bases and/or N bases. These reads are marked as they are usually artifactual and are of no use in downstream analysis. Read 1.
The number of PF reads that were aligned to the reference sequence. This includes reads that aligned with low quality (i.e. their alignments are ambiguous). Read 1.
The percentage of PF reads that aligned to the reference sequence. PF_READS_ALIGNED / PF_READS. Read 1.
The total number of aligned bases, in all mapped PF reads, that are aligned to the reference sequence. Read 1.

The number of PF reads that were aligned to the reference sequence with a mapping quality of Q20 or higher signifying that the aligner estimates a 1/100 (or smaller) chance that the alignment is wrong. Read 1.

The number of bases aligned to the reference sequence in reads that were mapped at high quality. Will usually approximate PF_HQ_ALIGNED_READS * READ_LENGTH but may differ when either mixed read lengths are present or many reads are aligned with gaps. Read 1.
The subset of PF_HQ_ALIGNED_BASES where the base call quality was Q20 or higher. Read 1.
The median number of mismatches versus the reference sequence in reads that were aligned to the reference at high quality (i.e. PF_HQ_ALIGNED READS). Read 1.
The rate of bases mismatching the reference for all bases aligned to the reference sequence. Read 1.
The percentage of bases that mismatch the reference in PF HQ aligned reads. Read 1.
The number of insertion and deletion events per 100 aligned bases. Uses the number of events as the numerator, not the number of inserted or deleted bases. Read 1.
The percentage of reads whose mate pair was also aligned to the reference. READS_ALIGNED_IN_PAIRS / PF_READS_ALIGNED. Read 1.
The number of instrument cycles in which 80% or more of base calls were no-calls. Read 1.
The number of PF reads aligned to the positive strand of the genome divided by the number of PF reads aligned to the genome. Read 1.
The percentage of PF reads that are unaligned and match to a known adapter sequence right from the start of the read. Read 1.

The number of PF reads that are marked as noise reads. A noise read is one which is composed entirely of A bases and/or N bases. These reads are marked as they are usually artifactual and are of no use in downstream analysis. Read 2.
The number of PF reads that were aligned to the reference sequence. This includes reads that aligned with low quality (i.e. their alignments are ambiguous). Read 2.
The percentage of PF reads that aligned to the reference sequence. PF_READS_ALIGNED / PF_READS. Read 2.
The total number of aligned bases, in all mapped PF reads, that are aligned to the reference sequence. Read 2.

The number of PF reads that were aligned to the reference sequence with a mapping quality of Q20 or higher signifying that the aligner estimates a 1/100 (or smaller) chance that the alignment is wrong. Read 2.

The number of bases aligned to the reference sequence in reads that were mapped at high quality. Will usually approximate PF_HQ_ALIGNED_READS * READ_LENGTH but may differ when either mixed read lengths are present or many reads are aligned with gaps. Read 2.
The subset of PF_HQ_ALIGNED_BASES where the base call quality was Q20 or higher. Read 2.
The median number of mismatches versus the reference sequence in reads that were aligned to the reference at high quality (i.e. PF_HQ_ALIGNED READS). Read 2.
The rate of bases mismatching the reference for all bases aligned to the reference sequence. Read 2.
The percentage of bases that mismatch the reference in PF HQ aligned reads. Read 2.
The number of insertion and deletion events per 100 aligned bases. Uses the number of events as the numerator, not the number of inserted or deleted bases. Read 2.
The percentage of reads whose mate pair was also aligned to the reference. READS_ALIGNED_IN_PAIRS / PF_READS_ALIGNED. Read 2.
The number of instrument cycles in which 80% or more of base calls were no-calls. Read 2.
The number of PF reads aligned to the positive strand of the genome divided by the number of PF reads aligned to the genome. Read 2.
The percentage of PF reads that are unaligned and match to a known adapter sequence right from the start of the read. Read 2.
The total number of PF reads.

The number of PF reads that are marked as noise reads. A noise read is one which is composed entirely of A bases and/or N bases. These reads are marked as they are usually artifactual and are of no use in downstream analysis. Pair.
The number of PF reads that were aligned to the reference sequence. This includes reads that aligned with low quality (i.e. their alignments are ambiguous). Pair.
The percentage of PF reads that aligned to the reference sequence. PF_READS_ALIGNED / PF_READS. Pair.
The total number of aligned bases, in all mapped PF reads, that are aligned to the reference sequence. Pair.

The number of PF reads that were aligned to the reference sequence with a mapping quality of Q20 or higher signifying that the aligner estimates a 1/100 (or smaller) chance that the alignment is wrong. Pair.

The number of bases aligned to the reference sequence in reads that were mapped at high quality. Will usually approximate PF_HQ_ALIGNED_READS * READ_LENGTH but may differ when either mixed read lengths are present or many reads are aligned with gaps. Pair.
The subset of PF_HQ_ALIGNED_BASES where the base call quality was Q20 or higher. Pair.
The median number of mismatches versus the reference sequence in reads that were aligned to the reference at high quality (i.e. PF_HQ_ALIGNED READS). Pair.
The median number of mismatches versus the reference sequence in reads that were aligned to the reference at high quality (i.e. PF_HQ_ALIGNED READS). Pair.
The percentage of bases that mismatch the reference in PF HQ aligned reads. Pair.
The number of insertion and deletion events per 100 aligned bases. Uses the number of events as the numerator, not the number of inserted or deleted bases. Pair.

The mean read length of the set of reads examined. When looking at the data for a single lane with equal length reads this number is just the read length. When looking at data for merged lanes with differing read lengths this is the mean read length of all reads.
The number of aligned reads whose mate pair was also aligned to the reference.
The percentage of reads whose mate pair was also aligned to the reference. READS_ALIGNED_IN_PAIRS / PF_READS_ALIGNED. Pair.
The number of instrument cycles in which 80% or more of base calls were no-calls. Pair.
The number of PF reads aligned to the positive strand of the genome divided by the number of PF reads aligned to the genome. Pair.
The percentage of reads that map outside of a maximum insert size (usually 100kb) or that have the two ends mapping to different chromosomes.
The percentage of PF reads that are unaligned and match to a known adapter sequence right from the start of the read. Pair.
Total lumpy-sv SV count that were genotyped by SVTyper, VCF start recorded was on Chr 1-22,X,Y,MT. Was not in LCR region or regions that commonly have very high depth
